params.data: The resulting data from the call. This is error data when the call was not a success. Otherwise,                this is malformed data when the call was a success.
params.success: If the call to the token was a success.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to claim.
params.recipient: The address which will receive the claimed tokens.

deposit(uint256,address).details: Deposits tokens to be exchanged into an account.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to deposit.
params.owner: The owner of the account to deposit the tokens into.

exchange(uint256).details: Exchanges `amount` underlying tokens for `amount` synthetic tokens staked in the system.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to exchange.

getClaimableBalance(address).details: Gets the claimable balance of an account, in units of `underlyingToken`.

params.owner: The address of the account owner.

getExchangedBalance(address).details: Gets the exchanged balance of an account, in units of `debtToken`.

params.owner: The address of the account owner.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getUnexchangedBalance(address).details: Gets the unexchanged balance of an account.

params.owner: The address of the account owner.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

withdraw(uint256,address).details: Withdraws tokens from the caller's account that were previously deposited to be exchanged.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to withdraw.
params.recipient: The address which will receive the withdrawn tokens.

ADMIN.details: The identifier of the role which maintains other roles.

SENTINEL.details: The identifier of the sentinel role

accounts.details: A mapping specifying all of the accounts.

buffer.details: the source of the exchanged collateral

conversionFactor.details: The amount of decimal places needed to normalize collateral to debtToken

syntheticToken.details: the synthetic token to be transmuted

totalBuffered.details: The total amount of tokens which are in the auxiliary buffer.

totalUnexchanged.details: The total amount of unexchanged tokens which are held by all accounts.

underlyingToken.details: the underlying token to be received

whitelist.details: The address of the external whitelist contract.

ERC20CallFailed(address,bool,bytes).notice: An error used to indicate that a call to an ERC20 contract failed.

IllegalArgument().notice: An error used to indicate that an action could not be completed because of an illegal argument was passed         to the function.

IllegalState().notice: An error used to indicate that an action could not be completed because the contract either already existed         or entered an illegal condition which is not recoverable from.

Unauthorized().notice: An error used to indicate that an action could not be completed because either the `msg.sender` or         `msg.origin` is not authorized.

AdminUpdated(address).notice: Emitted when the admin address is updated.

Paused(bool).notice: Emitted when the system is paused or unpaused.

PendingAdminUpdated(address).notice: Emitted when the pending admin address is updated.

userdoc.notice: A contract which facilitates the exchange of synthetic assets for their underlying
